sections.name: Masque Mannequin
Malevolent Mindsets
sections.text: Masque mannequins, even those crafted from virtuous individuals, tend to have a sadistic sense of malice. If left to their own devices, a masque mannequin enjoys playing cat and mouse games with their chosen victims by freezing and unfreezing in areas with mundane mannequins, slowly driving their unfortunate playthings to paranoia before going for the kill.

link.name: Pathfinder #205: Singer, Stalker, Skinsaw Man pg. 87
link.alt: Pathfinder #205: Singer, Stalker, Skinsaw Man pg. 87

sections.text: Masque mannequins are a type of soulbound construct animated by a fragment of a once-living soul infused into an eerie, nearly featureless mask that's then affixed to a mannequin or dressmaker's dummy. Though similar in process to the creation of a soulbound doll or mannequin, creating a masque mannequin requires conducting ritualistic murder and extracting a soul shard during an unwilling victim's death, and only the vilest of crafters would consider attempting such a deed. Masque mannequins are popular among Norgorberites, especially devotees of Father Skinsaw, as well as Kuthites who take pride in drawing out the ritual to gain the largest possible fragment of the soul.

link.name: Pathfinder #205: Singer, Stalker, Skinsaw Man pg. 87
link.alt: Pathfinder #205: Singer, Stalker, Skinsaw Man pg. 87

link.name: Pathfinder #205: Singer, Stalker, Skinsaw Man pg. 87
link.alt: Pathfinder #205: Singer, Stalker, Skinsaw Man pg. 87

traits.name: Uncommon
traits.text: Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2.

traits.name: Construct
traits.text: A construct is an artificial creature empowered by a force other than vitality or void.

traits.name: Soulbound
traits.text: These constructs are mentally augmented by a fragment of a once-living creature's soul.

link.name: Pathfinder #205: Singer, Stalker, Skinsaw Man pg. 87
link.alt: Pathfinder #205: Singer, Stalker, Skinsaw Man pg. 87

interaction_abilities.name: Soul Mask
interaction_abilities.text: The spark of the soul used to create a masque mannequin is infused into its mask. A creature can break a masque mannequin's soul mask with a DC 40 Athletics check or steal it with a DC 40 Thievery check. If its mask is broken or removed, a masque mannequin must attempt a DC 40 Fortitude save.

interaction_abilities.name: Critical Success
interaction_abilities.text: The masque mannequin's animating spark shifts to infuse its body; it is unaffected and no longer has a soul mask.

interaction_abilities.name: Success
interaction_abilities.text: The masque mannequin takes 2d6 persistent mental damage. If it regains its mask, it can place it back on its face as an Interact action to automatically stop this persistent mental damage.

interaction_abilities.name: Failure
interaction_abilities.text: As success, but 4d6 persistent mental damage and stunned 1.

interaction_abilities.name: Critical Failure
interaction_abilities.text: As failure, but 8d6 persistent mental damage and stunned 3.

automatic_abilities.name: Requirements
automatic_abilities.trigger: A creature unaware of the mannequin's true nature approaches within reach
automatic_abilities.effect: The mannequin makes a Strike against the triggering creature.
automatic_abilities.text: The masque mannequin is in Pose;

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

ability.name: Pose

traits.name: Concentrate
traits.text: An action with this trait requires a degree of mental concentration and discipline.

ability.text: Until the next time the masque mannequin acts, it appears to be an inanimate mannequin. It has an automatic result of 45 on Deception checks and DCs to appear as an ordinary mannequin.

ability.name: Refashion

traits.name: Incapacitation
traits.text: An ability with this trait can take a character completely out of the fight or even kill them, and it’s harder to use on a more powerful character. If a spell has the incapacitation trait, any creature of more than twice the spell’s rank treats the result of their check to prevent being incapacitated by the spell as one degree of success better, or the result of any check the spellcaster made to incapacitate them as one degree of success worse. If any other effect has the incapacitation trait, a creature of higher level than the item, creature, or hazard generating the effect gains the same benefits.

traits.name: Occult
traits.text:
This magic comes from the occult tradition, calling upon bizarre and ephemeral mysteries. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to occult magic.

ability.requirement: The masque mannequin is grappling a living creature
ability.effect: The grabbed creature must attempt a DC 36 Fortitude save.
ability.success: The creature is slowed 1 for 1 round as its body grows more wooden.
ability.failure: The creature is petrified for the next 24 hours, but instead of turning to stone, it turns into a wooden mannequin. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns.
ability.critical_failure: The creature turns into a wooden mannequin permanently.
